profileText: A Representative from New York; born in Schaghticoke, Rensselaer County, N.Y, on January 2, 1807; graduated, Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute, 1828; studied law; was admitted to the bar and practiced in Harts Falls, N.Y.; farmer; elected as a Whig to the Twenty-ninth Congress to fill the vacancy caused by the death of United States Representative Richard P. Herrick (December 7, 1846-March 3, 1847); was not a candidate for renomination in 1846; relocated to Saginaw, Mich. in 1854; member of the Michigan House of Representatives (1873-1874); died on February 12, 1897, in Saginaw, Mich.; interment in Oakwood Cemetery, Saginaw, Mich.

note.content: Elected to fill vacancy caused by death of Richard P. Herrick, and took his seat December 7, 1846.
